website_summaries.verdict: A good duo for light to medium tasks, but if you need a pair of sawhorses capable of handling higher weight loads, check out others on our list.
pros: Offers some user-friendly features including lightweight yet rugged build, convenient handles, stabilizing support braces, and no-slip 39.1" x 4.9" work surfaces
cons: Though rated to accommodate up to 330 lbs., some owners complained that they seem to too flimsy to handle that much weight

customer_reviews.title: These saw horses are a great value. The set up is very simple
customer_reviews.text: These saw horses are a great value. The set up is very simple, like a card table. The rubberized surface grips the material you are working with well and keeps them from sliding around. They heavy construction of the saw horses keeps them stable when they are loaded. The metal looks more professional than plastic saw horses. So far, they are very durable. They fold up compactly for easy storage and are a space saver. Also, there is a handle on top that makes it easy to transport them. These are much easier to take with me to job sites. I would consider buying another pair for my brother in law for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Better than their price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for DIYers. I purchased folding sawhorses because I am somewhat limited in space due to my tool addiction. Ha! I was a bit hesitant because folding sawhorses tend to not be as sturdy as a permanent structure. These work just fine and are just the right height to make whatever project you're doing comfortable. I had a bit of an issue folding them back up the first time. If you aren't careful you can damage the legs. But after a few aggravating moments I was able to figure it out. Great sawhorses for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor and I bought these for my personal use. Pros- sturdy well made steel easy to add two by four to tops. Easy to adjust heights. Cons- stops are so poorly placed you cannot open legs completely so they become unstable. I had to grind on mine to get them to even function. This product needs some work on the stops to take it to a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone S. Powers

customer_reviews.title: Neanderthal shipping
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and over all well made product but do you outsource your packing to Neanderthals? The plastic case that goes on the outside of,the product for protection was completely demolished on both products. One of my boxes had the end opened and the paint is scuffed up in some places and completely missing in others. For what I'm using them for the paint wasn't wasn't going to be "perfect" for long but I didn't expect the paint to come pre-destroyed. Other than the ham fisted packing, the product is decent. When you place something heavy on it the legs widen a little under the weight but it seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Daylon-James

customer_reviews.title: Check which option you’re buying
customer_reviews.text: Careful of which one you buy. I mistakenly bought the single sawhorse. It’s nice that they fold up and take up minimal space but it does take some adjusting to get them set up out of the box. They’re all metal so they’re a little heavy but it does add to the sturdiness. I wouldn’t weigh it down too much but small to medium size wood working projects, automotive body work will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S. Clements

customer_reviews.title: No hassle
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me from the hassle of going to an actual store and buying this to finish my work. I wasnt expecting a lot from this product since its very affordable and its portable. I thought its was going to be a cheap piece of metal. But im surprised to say that it exceeded my expectations about this product and Im a very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Aze88

customer_reviews.title: nice sawhorses
customer_reviews.text: These are reasonable sawhorses. They are metal and so have some weight. I am able to carry both at the same time. You can carry them as one unit of you can separate them into two units. They have better stability after you place a load on them. I like them for their portability to different job sites and the fact that they are not being extremely heavy.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We just got these in today and we really liked them! They were really easy to assemble and pretty sturdy! You can tell they can handle heavy weight. Took us less than 5 minutes a piece to put together and set up. I would definitely buy another set. Practical, good quality, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: annette828

customer_reviews.title: Substantial and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Made of heavy steel, with quality hardware, and a good paint job. Nothing cheap about them. Extremely rigid and sturdy. Impossible to make them wiggle. Holes in top allow you to attach a sacrifical board. Best sawhorses I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: PilotBill

customer_reviews.title: Great Company - Bad Saw Horse
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this a higher rating since the company did such a great job sending me another set after the 1st ones wouldn't open all the way. The legs hit the metal plate so they don't open all the way. Now I have 2 sets that don't work properly. I finally took a grinding wheel to the side plate so they would open.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Sosnicki

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I like the fold out plastic ones better. These were wobbly when you move or re-position them and don't get the legs aligned just so.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss. Mine missed.
customer_reviews.text: My sawhorse also had the leg locks welded on too close to the edge. I was ok with that at first because it was an excuse to pull out the angle grinder. After cleaning up the poor positioned leg locks, it turns out it’s just a completely defective unit and will not sit level anyway.
customer_reviews.author: SmashesGashes

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed with cheap rivits.
customer_reviews.text: A good idea at a low price, but too good to be true. One of the sawhorses fell apart the first time I extended it. The metal brace is held in place by a very poorly done rivet. I could have replaced the cheap rivets with bolts and nuts, but decided to return the sawhorses for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as described
customer_reviews.text: Good sawhorses, but description isn't accurate. When extended, work height is not almost 36 inches high as mentioned in the description. It's just over 32". Going to have to use something to raise them up to the level of our 36" table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Utah-Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great sawhorse
customer_reviews.text: Metal sawhorses are the way to go. They're stout, easy to fold, and last. Only quibble is you have to add a piece of wood to the feet to keep them from sinking the mud. Still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: NNW

customer_reviews.title: They always fall over when trying to move the plywood.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were a great gift and he said no they constantly fall over when you try and move something. :( This was not a good gift.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Super handy, high quality
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of buying the cheap, crappy plastic saw horses, when I saw these. Worth every penny. Sturdy, well made, works well. And they fold up and can be stored easily in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Am 6'6", so I really appreciate that they come up to 40". Very sturdy, solid, good construction. Highly recommended. Seller screwed up shipping, and it took like two weeks longer than it was supposed to take to get the product. But worth waiting for, and good enough that I'm not even going to subtract a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtquifer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Legs will not spread properly due to poorly aligned stops. Grinding is required to allow proper clearance for the legs to fully extend. Also, instructions refer to "locking pins". They do not exist. The concept is good but another example of cheap far east garbage. No quality control at all.
customer_reviews.author: Barry L Segal

customer_reviews.title: I really like these, they are wide and stable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, they are wide and stable. I'm an older lady so it is great to have them so portable and I used a circular saw on lumber, they worked great. I don't know about hard use but if you need occasional sawhorses, I recommend these
customer_reviews.author: JJB1111

customer_reviews.title: Light equipment and easily stored when folded
customer_reviews.text: Light equipment and easily stored when folded. Extending the legs is difficult at first. Needs periodic lubrication at the hings points. Rigid, not shaky when correctly deployed. Can support hundreds of pounds but don't push it.
customer_reviews.author: David Savageau

customer_reviews.title: Heavy metal
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty steel construction so they are a little heavy but worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Robbin G. Chatfield

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and folds away to save space, happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian H

customer_reviews.title: Good 32 inch sawhorse
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue to begin with and was resolved in a timely manner. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ljgorski

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and he Loves them. They are very compact and easy to use. Quick folding for the legs and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are a bit on the heavy side. They ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit on the heavy side. They are stable at default height, but seemed a little iffy at extension.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver Jr.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very sturdy. I haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.text: Really hard to open. But finally did. Seems to be very sturdy. I haven't used it yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably better just for making tables
customer_reviews.text: Not very heavy duty. Don't expect to be putting tons of weight on them. Probably better just for making tables.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: great size, height, and weight, just make sure you fully extend the legs and make sure they are set.
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, packs up for easy storage, and wide enough for most projects, nice surface so things don't slide, good tool for the price, would buy again. One word of caution, make sure legs etc. are fully extended and situated firmly before you put anything on it.
customer_reviews.author: Whisperkill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband likes his sawhorse and uses it frequently. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda B.

customer_reviews.title: handy to have
customer_reviews.text: A bit fiddly to deploy the legs but I like that they fold up into a self contained unit. Much better than the cheap plastic folding horses that will buckle with more than a 2 X 6 on them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Like these a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Like these a lot. They arrived on time. They seem to be sturdy. They can fold up so they don't take up much space in my garage
customer_reviews.author: Debra Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality. A legs are a bit flimsy
customer_reviews.text: One came broken and I had to try to fix it (it will work but it's not totally secure). Not great quality. A legs are a bit flimsy. Top had nice grip. Overall just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Bebop

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: to support pickup camper when jacks are down. camper weighs 2400 lbs. sawhorse are on lowest setting and work well.
customer_reviews.author: scresident

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and Solid. Hold my airplane wing firmly in place. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MyLucyPup

customer_reviews.title: expected better for the money
customer_reviews.text: very heavy and a bit hard to fold back up
customer_reviews.author: Adam Gist

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these look so much better and are more sturdy than the old fashion 2x4
customer_reviews.author: Ladie Dragster

customer_reviews.title: Space saving metal saw horses
customer_reviews.text: These are the best saw horses I have ever owned. They open easily , have a handle for carrying. Just moved from a large house w 2 car garage to small one with a very small 1 car garage. They hang on the wall taking up hardly any space at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have heavier saw horses and needed lighter ones. They work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My hubby is a welder. Bought these for his b-day. He likes em a lot they're very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: chrystal

customer_reviews.title: ... out a little wider for stability but they are good.
customer_reviews.text: Legs could fold out a little wider for stability but they are good.
customer_reviews.author: Shootsnscores

customer_reviews.title: like, sturdy a little bit hard to open but should wear in ok.  good deal overall.
customer_reviews.text: like, sturdy a little bit hard to open but should wear in ok. good deal overall.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. Does not firmly hold the boards. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Yosie

customer_reviews.title: They are not too sturdy when set up
customer_reviews.text: They are not too sturdy when set up. Didn't want to put too much weight on them just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and portable. I even went over the weight limit with a piece of steel.
customer_reviews.author: Epaminonda Orologas

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, them arrived rusted and do not fold up worth a darn. Save the 50 dollars
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Legs are take a bit of effort to unfold and refold. Once fully unfolded, proved a sturdy wobble free support.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Thomas

customer_reviews.title: What a waste. They bent and broke the first time I ...
customer_reviews.text: What a waste. They bent and broke the first time I ever used them. The cheap plastic ones from home depot are a hundred times better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Fast

customer_reviews.title: Not super heavy duty but that's not what I expected or ...
customer_reviews.text: Very compact. Stores in a small area. Not super heavy duty but that's not what I expected or needed anyway. The set up is so quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: More forced dialog.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, when I have nothing to say, but I have to in order to leave feedback?
customer_reviews.author: I shop here

product_meta.title: HICO 2-Pack Sawhorse Folding Metal Stands Mobile Bases Brackets Heavy Duty Fully Assembled Foldable Legs Twin Pack, Support 330lb, 32-Inch Tall, Pair
feature_bullets: Max. Open Size: 40 x 20 x 32 inches, Operation Platform Size: 39 x 5 inches, Work Height: 32 inches
Built with high strength metal construction. Cross brace on both sides makes sawhorse extra durable. Weight capacity up to 330 lbs
Anti-slip Work Surface and leg's mat makes extra stability and support to protect workers
Fully assembled, no installation Is required - just open the box, unfold the legs, lock into place, and start working
Foldable legs and grip handle designed for easy to transport and store
